description: One of the most strikingly colored parrots, with a vibrant mix of yellow, orange, red, and green plumage. Their full color comes in with maturity.
temperament: Playful, cuddly, and full of personality. They can be very nippy, especially when young, and require consistent handling.
loudness: Extremely Loud. They possess a notoriously loud, sharp, and piercing screech that they use frequently. This is the main reason they are surrendered.
vocalization: Can learn a few words and phrases, but are not known as great talkers. They are better at mimicking sounds.
dietaryNeeds: A diet based on pellets, supplemented with a variety of vegetables and fruits. They can be prone to feather-plucking if their diet is deficient.
healthPointers: Can live 20-30 years. Prone to Psittacine Beak and Feather Disease (PBFD) and feather plucking. Need lots of social interaction.
housing: Unsuitable for apartments. Their noise level is too high for shared living spaces. They need a cage of at least 24"W x 20"D x 30"H.
